item.title: Moon exploration adventure game Lunar Strike announced for PS5, Xbox Series, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Set on the Moon's South Pole in the year 2119.

Cognition Europe has announced Lunar Strike, a speculative fiction adventure game set on the Moon’s South Pole. It will be available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam. A release date was not announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Lunar Strike is a single-player narrative adventure and exploration game set on the Moon’s South Pole in the year 2119.

You play as a junior archivist sent to document humanity’s final lunar colony. Your mission begins with scanning and preserving scientific, cultural, and personal records.

But when sabotage destabilizes the colony, the task shifts to survival under real lunar conditions: managing oxygen, power, and time while deciding what knowledge and memory must endure. Every choice shapes the archive—and the outcome of the colony itself.

Developed with ethical questions of legacy, memory, and responsibility at its heart, players will face increasingly difficult challenges to build and preserve the archive, with multiple outcomes driven by their decisions and values.

Key Features

  • Narrative Adventure Set on the Moon’s South Pole (2119) – Explore a colony on the edge of collapse.
  • No Combat – Gameplay revolves around survival adventure, exploration, and preservation.
  • Archival Scanning Tools – Recover, analyze, and prioritize data across cultural, scientific, and personal domains.
  • Tactical Survival Mechanics – Manage oxygen, suit energy, and habitat systems under lunar constraints.
  • Branching Narrative Outcomes – Decisions on what to save or abandon reshape the colony’s legacy.
  • Forensic Reconstruction – Analyze a crime scene from scanned artifacts.
  • Characters that challenge your perspective.
  • Grounded in Real Science – Environments, orbital mechanics, and survival systems are modeled on current lunar research.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

item.title: Town of Zoz – Gamescom 2025 trailer
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Latest look at the cooking action RPG.

Publisher Humble Games and developer Studio Pixanoh have released the Gamescom 2025 trailer for narrative-driven cooking action RPG Town of Zoz.

The trailer introduces the “Nightmares,” twisted manifestations of unresolved emotions, lingering regrets, and family curses that threaten to consume the villagers from within.

Here is an overview of the game, via Humble Games:

About

Town of Zoz invites players to join the reluctant hero, Ito, as he returns to his family’s farm and restaurant in a village shrouded in mystery and ancient curses. This adventure blends fast-paced combat, deep storytelling, and a unique cooking mechanic, offering players a chance to explore a vibrant village while helping the townspeople rebuild bonds and uncovering an ancient magical presence.

With its blend of exploration, action combat, and heartwarming cooking mechanics, Town of Zoz invites players to uncover the mysteries of a town like no other. After receiving a letter from his parents, Ito reluctantly returns to his family’s farm and restaurant in the town of Zoz. As he settles back into life, he uncovers a deep, ancient magical presence that has gripped the village and threatens its future. Ito will need to use his combat skills, magical ingredients, and a dash of cooking creativity to restore the bonds of his community

Key Features

  • Welcome to the Town of Zoz – After receiving a letter from his parents, Ito reluctantly returns home to help the family farm and restaurant. As he settles back into family life, Ito realizes that the once peaceful village hides an ancient secret, and the town needs his help to reveal its forbidden past, and the dark cloud that haunts them.
  • Fight with Flavor – As you explore the area around Zoz and help the townspeople, take advantage of Ito’s skills with his trusty machete as you slash and dodge through enemies while teaming up with several trusted companions. Each one uses their own unique skills to dispatch enemies.
  • True Soul Food – Food is the way to people’s hearts in Zoz, and giving townsfolk their favorite meal will increase your bonds and allow you to learn more about them. Or eat the meals yourself to gain powerful stat boosts for your next hunt.
  • It Takes A Village – Everyone has a story to tell, and it’s up to Ito’s mastering of the soul-infused machete and his magic-infused recipes to help them overcome their personal nightmares. Help legendary town heroes, fashionable shopkeepers, stars of the Boonbola team, leaders of a local magical sect, and speak with a Soulsmith who is able to imbue magic into weapons and tools.
  • Local Cooperative Adventure – Join forces with friends for a cooperative adventure to explore Zoz together, cooking and fighting side-by-side to save the town.

Town of Zoz will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC (Steam. A release date has yet to be announced.

Watch the trailer below.

item.title: Serial World launches in 2026, published by Kakehashi Games
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Team up with mysterious creatures to uncover strange happenings.

Serial Project-developed deckbuilder / turn-based RPG Serial World will be published by Kakehashi Games when it launches for PC via Steam in 2026, the companies announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Kakehashi Games:

About

Serial World is a fantastical, genre-bending experience that fuses playful storytelling, exploration, and puzzle mechanics in a richly stylized, dreamlike world where players team up with mysterious creatures known as Anima to uncover strange happenings in their hometown.

With deck-building mechanics and DNA drawn from cult classic JRPGs and anime, Serial World stars a young boy named Milo, exploring whimsical and colorful worlds, raising Anima through and diving into a loop of battles and exploration. As the debut title from veteran developer duo Serial Project, Serial World will be published internationally by Kakehashi Games (Hirogami, SONOKUNI, Sagres).

Key Features

  • Roguelike Dungeons Meet JRPG Mechanics – Explore Bricktown to unlock new areas, chat with townsfolk, and collect useful items, then tackle the dungeons with your chosen trio of Anima. Hone your strategy with each consecutive loop as you navigate the ever-changing map system armed with your newest skills and traits!
  • Choose Your Anima -There are eight Anima in total for Milo to meet and battle with, and each Anima have different strengths! Vary your team to test out new tactics, whether it’s an all-out attack, a patient defense, or a strategic status effect sabotage.
  • Strategic Turn-Based Battles – Put the powers of your Anima to the test and face off against quirky foes in turn-based combat! Each Anima on your team can learn and use a personalized variety of skills – mix-and-match to brainstorm endless battle strategies. As combat intensifies, your Anima’s talisman will fill with power – use it to trigger their evolution, grow even stronger, and expand the depth of battles!
  • Friends and Foes Await – Encounter a colorful cast of characters as you venture into the unknown. Befriend cheerful neighbors, battle oddball enemies, and meet merchants, masters, and more! From bouncing dragons to baby donuts, you never know who you’ll meet next.
  • Unravel the Mystery Within – When Milo discovers a monstrous door on the outskirts of Bricktown, he’s thrown into a strange new world full of fantastical creatures, zany enemies, and seemingly-endless dungeon mazes. Each time he finds an exit, he suddenly wakes up at home in bed, and the journey begins again. Little by little, things in Bricktown begin to change, and as the days repeat, Milo slowly begins to unravel the truth of these otherworldly experiences.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: MILITSIONER open playtest now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Escape an ever-changing town guarded by a giant cop.

An open playtest for immersive simulation game MILITSIONER is now available for PC via Steam, publisher Critical Reflex and developer TALLBOYS announced.

Here is an overview of the playtest, via Critcal Reflex:

Explore a dynamic clockwork town, navigate the colossal policeman’s changing needs and emotions, and use your wits to escape from his watchful eye your own way.

The titular colossal Militsioner demanded that the following information be provided with a few fresh details on what players can expect!

  • You’re Always Being Watched – You can run, but you can’t hide from the Militsioner. Everything you do is monitored—from stealing, to vandalism, to being a menace to the local townsfolk.
  • Judgment Is Inevitable – There will be moments where you’ll have to decide what kind of person you are—and the town responds accordingly. Maybe you can build goodwill through meaningful conversations and have the townsfolk assist you. Or perhaps you’re more likely to use people as pawns to achieve your goals. Either way, the town always remembers.
  • There’s No Such Thing As A Simple Escape – This immersive sim isn’t for the faint of heart. You’ll need to learn the lay of the land, wait until the Militsioner is at his most vulnerable, and put your escape plan into action. But be warned. The consequences of a failed scheme could cost more than you’re willing to pay

A release date for MILITSIONER has yet to be announced.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: NetherWorld launches September 12
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Switch

Demo now available.

Pixel art side-scrolling action adventure game NetherWorld will launch for Switch and PC via Steam on September 12, publisher SelectaPlay and developer Hungry Pixel announced. A demo is available now for both platforms, and users can pre-order a physical edition for Switch.

Here is an overview of the game, via SelectPlay:

About

Step into Medoo’s tentacles one last time as NetherWorld prepares to unleash its full, filthy glory. What starts with a marriage crisis spirals into a riotous narrative adventure packed with brutal boss battles, twisted humor, roguelike dungeon runs, and a cast of deranged characters you’ll love to hate (or hate to love). Whether you’re gambling away your dignity in vile minigames or facing off against nightmarish foes, every moment of NetherWorld is soaked in sleaze, style, and strangely heartfelt depravity.

Key Features

  • Narrative Mayhem – Help Medoo piece together his broken life through a twisted, alcohol-fueled journey full of depraved humor and outrageous encounters.
  • Unhinged Minigames – Win items and money in drinking competitions, seedy encounters, shootouts, or while controlling Tick Joe in filthy roguelike dungeons.
  • Brutal Boss Battles – Face off against savage bosses with a wide array of weapons—or go in swinging with bare tentacles.
  • Pixel Art with Bite – Explore a beautifully grotesque pixel world packed with shocking surprises and morally questionable choices.
  • Depravity with Depth – Beneath the drugs, bullets, and vodka, NetherWorld explores real themes of loneliness, failure, and trying to put yourself back together.

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer

item.title: Survival crafting adventure game Witchspire announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Due out in Early Access in 2026.

Envar Games, the newly established game development division of Envar—known for co-development contributions to titles like League of Legends, Overwatch 2, and Valorant—has announced Witchspire, a survival crafting adventure game launching in Early Access for PC via Steam in 2026.

“Witchspire marks a new chapter for us as a studio, and we couldn’t be prouder,” said Envar CEO Atey Ghailan in a press release. “We’ve worked with industry giants such as Riot Games, Blizzard Entertainment, Tencent, Netflix, and Wizards of the Coast and now have the opportunity to create our own world in the survival and adventure game genres. This announcement is our first step in building a AA studio and establishing Witchspire as a fresh, new quality [intellectual property] and we’re delighted to be able to share it with you.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Prepare to get lost in the hand-crafted world of Witchspire, a cooperative survival adventure game where you and your friends assume the roles of novice witches and wizards striving to find their way home in a magical land where an ancient darkness rises.

Key Features

  • Survival Made Magical – Call forth forests when you’re short on timber, spirit jump up ledges, blink out of the way of attacks, and send out magical pickaxes to do the tedious work.
  • Befriend Diverse Familiars – The wilderness is filled with fascinating creatures, defeat them in battle and collect their spirits to tame familiars. Build long-term bonds and guide their growth to support your play style and needs.
  • Conjure a New Home – Use astral projection to untether yourself from gravity, allowing for free movement as you build the perfect home to suit your coven’s needs.
  • The Ancients and Corruption – Falling comets, corrupted spirits and deadly creatures lurk in the shadows, waiting. You must keep your wits about you, and prepare for whatever darkness stirs beneath the surface.
  • Find Your Strength in Numbers – Dive into a cosmos of customization where a branching tech tree, player levelling, and varied crafting options give every witch a part to play in uncovering the mystery of the Witchspire. Start on your path with unique outfits and abilities by joining a coven, from the brave Cloudpiercers, to the mystical Foretellers.

A Game for Everyone

  • I’m looking for… Survival
    • Build freely with Astral Projection.
    • Master a cosmos of upgrades.
    • Magically conjure and harvest resources.
    • Craft and loot useful gear.
    • Battle wild and corrupted creatures.
  • I’m looking for… Creature Collecting
    • Form bonds and level them.
    • Discover unique and rare variants.
    • Assign tasks to your Familiars.
    • Use special abilities in combat.
    • Unique creatures to different biomes.
  • I’m looking for… Adventure
    • Explore gorgeous hand-crafted biomes.
    • Traverse the skies by Broom.
    • Play solo or in cooperative play.
    • Travel in style with magic.
    • Adventure through ancient ruins.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.
